summary: This ENB is designed to give Skyrim a more natural look, with better looking saturation and color levels. All while trying to be as performance friendly as possible [no fancy ENB effects]
descriptionHtml:
[center][size=6][b]Nihilism ENB
[/b][/size][u]                                                                                                               [/u]
[size=3]This ENB is designed to give Skyrim a more natural look, with better looking saturation and color levels. All while trying to be as performance friendly as possible [no fancy ENB effects that kill fps]. With this enb and some other mods i have installed, i can still hit 60 fps on high settings with a gtx 950. Your milage will vary with your config though.

 I originally started with the wonderful [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/71270/?]Illusion ENB[/url], but made my own extensive tweaks to it to fit my personal tastes, but big Kudos to the creator of that ENB!

[/size][size=3]I made this ENB with [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/17802/?]Climates Of Tamriel[/url] & [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/27043/?]Enhanced Lights And FX[/url] installed! I highly recommend you install those mods to get a similar experience as of my photos, but you should still get the same general look without them.
[/size][u][size=3]                                                                                                               
[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/78525-0-1473122569.gif[/img]
[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/78525-1-1473122665.gif[/img]
[img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/78525-0-1473122666.gif[/img]
[/size][/u]
[size=6][u]Installation[/u]
[/size][size=4][Make sure you have bFloatPointRenderTarget=1 in your SkyrimPerfs.ini!]

1) Download v.308 of the ENB files from [url=http://enbdev.com/download_mod_tesskyrim.html]here[/url]

2) Extract the ENB folder. Go inside the Wrapper Version Folder, and copy over the d3d9.dll and enbhost.exe files into your Skyrim directory
(something like this: C:/Program Files(x86)/Steam/steamapps/common/Skyrim)
(Not into the Data Folder!)

3) Download my files and extract and copy them to that same directory, overriding those in there with mine if prompted[/size]
[u][size=4]                                                                                                               [/size][/u]

[size=6]Toggle Combinations:[/size]
[size=4]Shift + Enter : Show ENB Menu
Shift + Z : Turn ENB Off and On in game
* Key : show fps[/size][/center][center][/center]
author: crisdiaz
